intro: Saussurea tianshuiensis, commonly known as the Tianshui saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant is typically found in alpine meadows at high elevations, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
